Name: Drug Czars
Description:
The game of international drug interdiction by the U.S.

U.S. player attempts to prevent the Drug Czar player(s) from importing their contraband without turning America into a police state, while the Drug Czars attempt to get rich while avoiding arrest and their fellows.

Name: Divinus: Shadow of Yggdrasil
Description:
Gather your friends and experience this 8 scenario prequel campaign, playing as four gods of the Norse Pantheon. Rewrite this epic story with your own choices and face the shadows lying beneath the ancient tree of life, Yggdrasil.

-description from the publisher

Name: Tchotchke Wars
Description:
Tchotchke Wars uses ordinary items laying around the house, in your book bag, or picked up from your favorite con to power your character in their war. It is a 2 player game that takes 10-30 minutes to play for ages 10 and up. The goal of the game is to reduce your opponent's health to zero.

How To Play
Players flip a coin, roll a die, or sign an international peace accord to determine who goes first. Players then attack, defend, gain health, etc.
all activating that tchotchke's attributes.

Attacking
The first player picks a tchotchke from the shared pile, declares what aspect they are using, then resolve that aspect based on the result on the character card.

Defending
After the attacking player chooses the tchotchke attribute they are attacking with, the defending player can defend themselves by invoking an  attribute that allows them to block only from that same tchotchke.

Name: Divinus: Base Game Recharge Pack
Description:
Thanks to this Recharge Pack, players are able to restart Divinus once they have completed its campaign. Using glue-less stickers for anything attaching to the tiles, and the board, only the player tuckboxes, the rulebook and a fresh sheet of stickers is needed to put your copy 100% back to a fresh start!

—description from the publisher

Name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield Fusion Strike
Description:
The path ahead is riddled with rivals and fierce battles. Fortunately, it also harbors limitless potential as the new Fusion Strike style emerges, capturing the unbound spirit of Pokémon and Trainers alike! Adaptable new Pokémon V like Genesect V, Hoopa V, and Mew VMAX are eager for battle, while Single Strike and Rapid Strike Pokémon loom large as Rillaboom VMAX, Cinderace VMAX, and Inteleon VMAX appear in their Gigantamax forms. Go with the flow and discover powerful new strategies in Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Fusion Strike!
—description from the publisher

Adds over 260 new cards to the game.
—user summary

Name: Pokémon TCG: Celebrations
Description:
Celebrate some of Pokémon's greatest moments over 25 years of adventure, discovery, and friendship! The Celebrations expansion offers plenty to be excited about, including an opportunity to stroll down memory lane with classic Pokémon TCG cards. Add a joyous parade of Legendary, Mythical, and other beloved Pokémon to your collection, including Mew, Ho-Oh, Zamazenta, Flying Pikachu, and Surfing Pikachu. Join the party with the Pokémon TCG: Celebrations expansion!

        - publisher's blurb


Adds more than 45 cards to the game.

        - user summary

Name: America The New Game
Description:
America The New Game is a word game whose deck celebrates the United States of America, probably in conjunction with the 1993 Chicago World's Fair -- it being published in Chicago that year.

Its deck includes letters cards to cover the alphabet twice, in red and in black, and each letter has a different painting by the designer about an aspect of American history and heritage. About half the cards cover history, including Leif Ericsson, Columbus, the Mayflower, Declaration of Independence, first railroads, etc.  The rest of the cards cover the geographic range of America: the cities Washington D. C., Chicago and New York; the Statue of Liberty, steamboats, Niagara Falls, cotton plantations, wheat fields, orange groves, farms, cattle ranches, etc. It also includes an American Flag wild card, and a rules card. The cards are bridge size, measuring 88mm x 57mm.

It has rules for two games. "America" plays like Gin Rummy, with players drawing and discarding until someone goes out by playing a 7-letter word. At that point, everyone scores a word from their hand with bonus points for longer words, and for names of American cities or states. The largest point total is awarded if the 7-letter word is "America". "Alphabet Rhummy" plays like normal rummy, letting you play words to the table once you have them, as well as add letters to existing words to make new words. The first player out of cards gets one point per card in everyone else's hands.

Name: まじかる☆キングダム (Magical Kingdom)
Description:
In the land of bread and magic, the queen has a dream: to create an ideal kingdom. Roll dice, gather resources, and use the power of your character and your tableau to build a kingdom worthy of praise!

This game uses the same system as Magical Bakery: A Conglomerate from Today, but includes additional content in its box to allow for more variety in setups and different potential for tableau building. (Note that each game is separate, and the two games cannot be combined.) Over the course of the game, you will gather resources and use them to play cards to your tableau, earning yourself victory points and additional abilities. The game ends after one player has at least 20 VP in their tableau; the player with the most points wins the game!

On your turn, you will roll three dice (or four, for one character), with seven different types of actions available. Dice can be used to acquire cards from a common market to your hand or to generate resources in three different types (gold, influence, and magic). Resources and dice together can be used to play cards from your hand into your tableau, or to build a legendary card. Resources can be used on their own to refresh the market or be converted into the other resource types. And cards in your tableau can be used to generate special effects. Use a combination of luck and strategy to build an engine that will push you ahead of the other players in the game in order to bring the most renown to yourself and the kingdom.

Cards are Chimera size (58x90mm).

Name: Rapture: Angels Starter Box
Description:
One of the game factions.

The Angels were created by a civilization classified as Type III on the Kardashev scale - commonly refered as "gods" - in the center of the Milky Way. Originally entrusted with the cultivation and harvesting processes, the angels were further developed into combat units after the first confrontation with the Lhon'Dar.

Once the harvesting sphere has been successfully deployed on a planet, the angels are responsible for cleansing the planet and preparing it for the next cultivation.

The angels appear to absorb the light around them, which is why they always seem to be surrounded by darkness.

Name: BANG! The Great Train Robbery
Description:
Expansion for BANG! card game. This expansion is co-designed with Czech and Slovak players and brings new mechanics, new cards to be shuffled with the basic deck, and 8 brand-new characters.

The expansion focuses on a track of Railroad cards and a Locomotive card: Each Railroad card is coupled with a Station tile; every time the Sheriff’s turn begins, the train moves and the value of the Railroad cards change depending on the Station tiles. Once during their turn, players may pay the cost shown on a Station to take the corresponding Wagon.

There are two kinds of Railcars: blue-bordered Railcards stay in play until discarded, and take effect immediately; while green-bordered Railcars stay in play but have no effect until the owner decides to discard them during their turn. If a Railcar is taken, the other Railcars on the train slide up to cover the gap, and a new one is added to the end of the train. As soon as the first Railcar behind the Locomotive goes past the last Station, the Locomotive card’s special effect triggers for all players. Then a new track of 5 Station tiles, as well as a new train, is built in the center of the table.

Name: Birdy
Description:
Birdy can be played in two very different ways. Whether it involves matching colours and collecting birds or putting down bird cards on ones that have already been set out – both game variants promise loads of fun and develop children’s matching abilities.

Game 1: Feeding the birds 
 At the moment the birds can’t find anything to eat around them and need help from humans. Attract the  birds with food so that they don’t have to go hungry. The 25 bird cards are shuffled and then spread out on  the table face down. Three arbitrary cards are left face up so they are visible to all players, and the dice are 
placed nearby.
 The first player to roll a birdhouse starts. He then chooses one of the 3 face-up cards and tries to attract the selected bird by rolling the matching colours. The player has a total of 3 attempts, and can set aside any matching dice with each attempt – and continue to roll the dice/die the remaining times. The picture of a birdhouse functions as a joker and can stand for any colour. The X on the die is a „Lame Duck“, and can’t be placed anywhere. If the player manages to cover all colours after rolling the dice (a maximum of) three times, he can keep the card – otherwise, he has to put the card back. It is then the next player’s turn. If the previous player was able to collect a bird, then a new card is turned face up, so that there are 3 cards face up again. The object of the game is to attract 3 of the same kind of bird.
The game ends when one player has attracted 3 of the same birds. That player wins the round. If none of the players succeeds, the one who has collected the most birds wins.

Game 2: Bird dominoes

Can you link all of the birds onto the long chain of birds? Try to be the first player to attach all of your birds to the long row of birds. The 25 bird cards are shuffled thoroughly and spread out face down on the table – one card in the middle is turned face up, and one die is placed nearby. Then each player is given 4 bird cards to start with.

The first player to roll a birdhouse starts. The first player to roll a birdhouse starts. He rolls with one die, and there are the following possibilities:

     Rolls a colour: The colour that is rolled matches a “free colour point” on the card in the middle and one of the bird cards that the active player has shows the same colour – very good, the bird  card can be placed
     Rolls a colour: The colour that is rolled is not a “free colour point” or the active player doesn’t have a bird card that shows the colour – too bad, it’s the next player’s turn
     Rolls a “Lame Duck”: The active player draws a “penalty card”
     Rolls a joker: The active player can place an arbitrary card on a free and matching colour point


The player who is first to place all of his bird cards wins the game.

Name: Erstes Englisch
Description: For the first steps in the English language, you can play lotto or memory or bingo with the 36 picture cards, check the pronunciation if you want, and otherwise just play the usual classics and become familiar with the basic vocabulary. Accompaniment by an adult who speaks English is an advantage. The illustrations are child-friendly and interesting, the game principles familiar enough that one is not distracted.

Name: Erstes Schreibspiel
Description:
A letter of the alphabet serves as a travel route for the ABC-mobile, in addition, there is a timetable on the letter card, which indicates in which order the stations must be completed. The letters have in principle no stations in the rounds, with the O the two stations are placed at the top, so that one accommodates them at all. On this basis, there are several game variants for one or more children, you can also lay and travel whole words. Whoever reaches the end of his timetable first and has been to all the stations on his letter card wins.

—user summary

Name: BattleTech: Wolf's Dragoons Assault Star
Description:
The Wolf's Dragoons are the most well-known and respected mercenary command in the Inner Sphere and their Mech Warriors are some of the most skilled and feared across hundreds of worlds. Once more, the Inner Sphere is poised for war and the Wolf's Dragoons are on the forefront.

This B&N Exclusive Expansion set includes the new Annihilator, as well as re-posed Timber wolf and Rifleman and new variants of the Archer and Blackjack BattleMechs - no assembly required - along with 10 MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards! Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

Name: A Tale of Bravery
Description:
A story driven adventure game for 1 to 4 players set in fantasy Britain some 20 years after the death of King Arthur Pendragon.

Each separate game session, or “quest” as it is called in the game, takes about 1 hour to play. Each quest can be won, lost, or even forfeited. The game is over when you have played through all quests listed in a separate questbook.

Each one of the players controls a “hero”. There are four heroes to the so called “party”. The players win the game if they manage to complete the goals of all the quests of the game.

The players will take turns reading aloud from the questbook. At regular intervals the players are allowed to make decisions on where to go and what to do. This affects the outcome of the game session. Whenever a fight occurs, it is played out on a game board made of separate modular tiles. The combat system is quick and focused on tactics and using the hero’s abilities to survive.

During the course of the game the players will be able to improve their heroes abilities, and also her equipment and retinue.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ich sehe was! Was siehst Du?
Description:
A game designed to help children read emotions of people especially during the Covid pandemic where faces are covered by masks.
Made by a childcare worker and designed for use in schools or other educational institutions. Comes with an app and other downloadable games that could be used with that cards set.

The game is more about learning and getting people interested into this topic. 
However, the game flow and win condition are as follows:
You have the card pile in your hand and have to allocate the top card to one of the five emotions. Look at the back of the card to check if you were right. If you were right, keep the card and pass on the pile to the next player. If you were wrong put the card underneath the pile and pass it on. If the pile rans out of cards, the game ends. The player with the most cards win the game.

—user summary

Ein Spieler hat alle Karten, nimmt die oberste und rät, welche Emotion es ist. Liegt man richtig, darf man die Karte behalten und gibt die restlichen Karten weiter! Liegt man falsch, legt man sie unter den Stapel und gibt ihn weiter! Immer der Reihe nach! Wenn der Stapel durch ist, schaut man, wer am meisten Karten besitzt. Derjenige hat gewonnen!

—description from the designer (German)

Name: Quick Quiz: Querdenker
Description:
100 game cards with 250 questions.
The question is asked and the quickest player with correct answer gets a point. Subjects: past times, world travel, animals up close, stars and starlets, would you have known? 
Who collect 25 points first wins the game.

—user summary

Name: So werden Sie Weltmeister im Batterien-Verkaufen
Description:
This soccer game is played on a small field with 11 Nails on each side (representing soccer players) but which actually act as obstacles, a small steel ball and two plastic ice cream spoons to kick the steel ball. The players take turns trying to put the ball in the opponent's goal.
The player to score the most goals in an agreed time, wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Cacti
Description:
In Cacti, you are a bristly gardener seeking to create succulent arrangements in a community garden. Uproot cacti, and supplant pots to achieve the best botanical beauties. But your prickly neighbors have their own sorted assemblage in mind and will try to spoil your toils with their barbed ideas. Plot your preferred assortments in five passive aggressive rounds to gardening contentment.

On your turn, you will swap the position of two cards in the garden, then flip one of them to lock it in place (but losing its flower). End your turn by placing one of your four score cards face down to claim a row or column of cactus arrangements.

After five rounds, count your scores from all of your score cards and flowers in your claimed rows/columns. The player with the highest score wins the game!

Misdirect other players with your score cards, sabotage their arrangements, and hoard pots and cacti.

—description from the publisher

Name: Too Many Bones: The Automaton of Shale
Description:
How do you top our legendary Too Many Bones Logbooks? This is the only way we knew how!

The Automaton of Shale is a brand new Too Many Bones short story, told in verse by Logan Giannini and enhanced by beautiful pop-up art by Anthony Letourneau, with paper engineered by Sam Ita.

The book contains a unique Too Many Bones adventure, complete with new encounters, loot, baddies and a new tyrant to battle at the end of the adventure. These pieces may be played front to back as a singular adventure or mixed with your existing Too Many Bones content.

—description from the publisher

Name: Road Trip
Description:
Road Trip is an 18 card solo game about a journey across the country. Find the most efficient route for your travels to make it the best road trip by arranging your 9 stops in geographical order (stop number) from left to right using Actions before your deck runs out.

Shuffle all 18 postcards together and set the Route by laying out a line of 9 face up going across the playing area. Set the remainder as the draw deck. Start your adventure by drawing three cards from the deck. Using the actions on the backs, play a card and adjust the Route accordingly. Then draw a new card to bring your hand back to three cards. Continue playing until you have rearranged the Route in order (win), or run out of cards in the deck (lose).

—description from the publisher

Name: Divinus: Shadow of Yggdrasil Recharge Pack
Description:
Thanks to this Recharge Pack, players are able to restart the Shadow of Yggdrasil expansion once they have completed its campaign. Using glue-less stickers for anything attaching to the tiles, and the board, only the player tuckboxes, the rulebook and a fresh sheet of stickers is needed to put your copy 100% back to a fresh start!

—description from the publisher

Name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Alpine/Lunar Hexless Battlemap
Description: This map is 34” x 22", The map is high-resolution with great color quality, making it one of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes an Alpine battlefield and the secondary side includes a Lunar battlefield.

Name: Back to the Future: Card Game
Description:
Join forces to get the Delorean to 88MPH and go back to the future! Clear all the Paradoxes by using Flux Energy. The problem is, all players are playing from the future and cannot communicate, you can only send signals!

Players need to work together to clear the Paradoxes by laying Flux Energy cards with different values to fulfill each Paradox objective, clearing it from the time continuum.

Each Paradox has a unique problem that must be fixed. Decode the paradox card and find out how to solve them. Once the requirements of the Paradox are met the Delorean is able to move to that space.

You must lay a card on your turn. You can play a card even if it does not help to fix a Paradox or if you cannot go or choose not to go you can reveal the next Paradox in the line. However this causes another Paradox to appear in the future!

Name: E.T. Phone Home: Card Game
Description:
Help E.T. phone home before the Agents find him. Work together using Action cards to inspect and manipulate the Movie Deck to find E.T.'s Phone parts hidden within.

On your turn, you play one action card and carry out each row of instructions from left to right, starting at the top. At the end of your turn draw back to 4 cards.

Find all 6 parts to save E.T. from the Agents scattered throughout the deck. If you find all 6 Agents and lose all of E.T.'s disguises, he will be captured and your mission will be over!

Name: Knight Rider: KITT vs KARR Card Game
Description:
Lifelong rivals KITT and KARR go head-to-head in a destructive battle for victory. Drain your opponent’s energy by racing around the map and performing stunts to either attack or defend.

Players choose a Drive card from their hand to
play face down. When flipped over, whoever has the fastest speed goes first. If the colour button matches your previous card you can choose to activate a stunt.

Stunts can be used to attack your opponent, defend an attack or move past or through roadblocks. To perform stunts, players have to perform trick-shots with their car discs.

Name: Museum: Deluxe Edition
Description:
It’s the turn of the 20th century, the golden age of museums. As interest in and accessibility of museums grew exponentially, many institutions underwent an intense period of expansion on both an intellectual and physical level, searching to grow their collections for profit and science.

You play as a curator of one such museum and it’s your job to build the biggest, most coherent collection that you can in this game of collection and bartering featuring over 300 individual illustrations by Vincent Dutrait and authentic architectural facts. But it’s no simple task!

Each player in Museum has a small collection of relics to get them started, after which, they will have to send explorers around the world to uncover others. These relics each have a value which is either the cost to add them to your museum, or how much they contribute towards adding other relics to your museum. “Spent” Relics are added to your reserve. You can withdraw them from it by exchanging them for an equal number of items; however, your opponents also has access to your reserve!

During the game you will be required to assemble different collections. These can be from different categories (war, agriculture, architecture, etc) or periods (Ancient Egypt, Rome, Aztec, etc). Patron cards will give you bonus cards for amassing certain collections. Explorer cards will allow you to hire famous archeologists to confer bonuses to your museum and event cards will provide you with some game changing circumstances that you’ll have to work around, based on historical events!

All these different elements make compiling your collection an interesting and sometimes tricky experience! At the end of the game points are scored based on collections and their value and the player with the most points wins!

Deluxe Editon holds all Museum Expansions

Name: Baltic Empires: The Northern Wars of 1558-1721
Description:
"Baltic Empires" is an approachable 2-5 player strategic level wargame about conflicts between the states of the Baltic region during the early modern era, a transformative period of religious conflict, large scale warfare, and constant struggles for power. Players will have to develop their economy, strengthen their administration, secure trade hubs, and finally build armies to become the dominant power of the Baltics. Denmark-Norway, Sweden, Russia, Poland-Lithuania, and Prussia will fight for hegemony, using variable victory conditions that reflect their respective historical objectives. Gameplay involves collecting resources, building new infrastructure and units, recruiting historical figures to your court, and finally going to war to expand your empire and fulfil your national ambition.

Highlights:

     Five asymmetric factions with unique abilities and objectives
     A highly thematic deck of historical Dramatis Personae to constitute your royal court
     A simple yet deep economic system that forces players to make tough decisions regarding their finances and wage war for key resources
     A streamlined battle system based on custom dice per unit type
     Variable player counts, from 2 to 5 players, and variable game lengths, with scenarios ranging from a tight duel to a diplomatic heavy conflict with alliances and betrayals


—description from the publisher

Name: Mythical Beings
Description:
A 2-player versus card game. Each player creates a team of 3 creatures, which will draw on allies and spells available in the market to deal damage to their opponents.
The game ends when one of the two players exhausts their initial 20 life points.
The strategy of combining the creatures, each with their own abilities, and the acquisition and play of the cards is decisive in winning a game.

Name: The Quacks of Quedlinburg: MegaBox
Description:
This Mega Box includes the original The Quacks of Quedlinburg, The Herb Witches expansion and The Alchemists expansion, all in one box!

In The Quacks of Quedlinburg, players are charlatans — or quack doctors — each making their own secret brew by adding ingredients one at a time. Take care with what you add, though, for a pinch too much of this or that will spoil the whole mixture!

Each player has their own bag of ingredient chips. During each round, they simultaneously draw chips and add them to their pot. The higher the face value of the drawn chip, the further it is placed in the swirling pattern, increasing how much your potion is worth. Push your luck as far as you can, but if you add too many cherry bombs, your pot explodes!

At the end of each round, players gain victory points and coins to spend on new ingredients to add to their bags, depending on the strength of the ingredients in their pots. But players with exploded pots must choose points or coins — not both! The player with the most victory points at the end of nine rounds wins the game.

Included in this box are:


     The Quacks of Quedlinburg: the base game
     The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Herb Witches: the first expansion, adding Witches that grant powers once per game as well as more ingredient books.
     The Quacks of Quedlinburg: The Alchemists: the second expansion introduces nightmares, obsession, hysteria and a new laboratory player board.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: BattleTech: Salvage Box – Legendary
Description:
The BattleTech Legendary Salvage Box is a blind box containing one plastic miniature for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also contains the matching pilot card and Alpha Strike dry-erase card for the miniature.

The Battletech Legendary Salvage box was created as a part of the Clan Invasion Kickstarter 2019.

Each box contains one of the following miniatures & pilots determined randomly:


     ARC-2R Archer (Morgan Kell)
     Dire Wolf Widowmaker (Natasha Kerensky)
     MAD-3R Marauder (Grayson "Death" Carlyle)
     Timber Wolf (Aidan Pryde)

Name: Cotton Trade: 1800-1860
Description:
It is the early 19th century. The Industrial Revolution is underway, and the demand for cotton is soaring. As a British entrepreneur, you see an opportunity to profit from this booming market. You will send your ships all over the world in search of the best prices for cotton. Will you keep up with the expanding market and become the most successful merchant?

The game is played over 9 rounds in 3 stages. At the start of each round, players compare the wealth of their companies to determine turn order. Then, they rent ships, send ships to regions where cotton is harvested, buy cotton, and return to the United Kingdom to sell cotton at a profit. At the end of each round, players pay a ship maintenance cost and clear the board for the next round. Players can also benefit from transporting passengers and exporting small amounts of goods from the United Kingdom.

The game uses a deck of 24 ship cards with different properties, including maximum capacity. Cotton can be purchased from contract cards of different quantities and prices in four historical regions where cotton was harvested. Droughts and local wars can interrupt players' plans and, along with the order of cards being drawn from the decks, are the main random factor of the game.

Ships are rented when only limited information about cotton harvests is available, adding to the difficulty of managing trading companies. Players can sell shares of their company to obtain additional funding, but they are required to repurchase all of their assets at the end of the game.

There are no victory points in this game. The player who owns the wealthiest company at the end wins.

Relative cotton prices and amounts of cotton harvested in different regions were based on real-world economic data. In order to simulate the exponential growth of the market, the game rescales itself between stages. This allows players to keep up with the cotton boom without having to handle large amounts of coins and tokens.

Advanced game rules introduce the possibility of buying other players' shares, among other options. This way, players can invest in and profit from their competitors' success.

—description from the designer

Name: Family Affairs
Description:
There are many secrets hidden in this big old city. But the main one is vampires. A hundred years ago there were so many of them here, and they behaved so openly and brazenly that people declared a hunt for them. The angry crowd caught all the bloodsuckers and buried them with aspen stakes in their chests. And this was forgotten for many years. But a small group of vampires managed to escape. For a hundred years they wandered around the world, and it's time to return to their hometown to resurrect their deceased relatives.

In the game Family Affairs, players will take on the role of the heads of vampire families. Their task is to resurrect as many of their blood-sucking relatives as possible in six nights. To do this, you need to find as many tombstones as possible. Then dig up the bodies and give the poor fellows fresh blood to drink.
Capturing cemeteries will help your family complete the mission faster, but you should be wary of fanatical Vampire Hunters.

Family Affairs is a roll and write game. In it, you will take on the role of vampire families who are looking for their long-dead relatives. There are eight vampire families to choose from in the game, each of which gives you a unique gaming experience. The main task of the game is to paint over as many graves with vampires as possible, resurrecting them. To do this, you will need to find the tombstones first.

Gameplay: throw dice and try to throw "6" on them - i.e. resurrect a vampire and not throw "1" - i.e. stumble upon a Vampire Hunter.

Each turn you will capture a new cemetery. Each captured cemetery will give you new opportunities for the rest of the game. For example, to throw more dice or resurrect vampires not only by "6", but also by "5". The head of the vampire family must skillfully decide which cemetery to capture first and which to leave for later. The opportunity to make Sorties brings more excitement. You can double all the resurrected vampires, but at the same time reduce the number of Vampire Hunters from whom your family can hide.

You have only six moves to assemble a well-functioning game engine and win.

—description from the publisher

Name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Box of Power
Description:
Contains all the exclusive stretch goals unlocked during the Clash for Eternia Kickstarter, including a box to store everything.

Stretch goals and daily reveals included:

     Heroic Warriors (16)
     Evil Warriors (16)
     NPCS (3)
     alternate Warrior models (12)
     3D plants + terrain tokens
     curve overlays
     cross overlays
     token containers
     lesson cards
     Holiday + Revenge of the Doppelgangers scenarios

Name: Crocs' Socks!
Description:
Oh oh, the crocodile's missing a sock! Who is the fastest and finds his matching sock so that Kroko has a complete pair again? The Crocs' Socks! game is an active board game for children and parents. You play it with one to four players. The game consists of cards with coloured socks, cards with a crocodile with only one sock on and four ploppers. One of the participants turns over a card and then everyone tries to catch the missing sock with the plopper as quickly as possible. But watch out! Does Kroko need a left or right sock?

—description from the publisher

Name: Balkan Railways
Description:
Balkan Railways - the first expansion for Iberian Railways - stretches from Istanbul to Trieste, from Albania to Romania on two 11x17 inch color maps.

19 new Business Interest cards are supplied, as are the Special Rules for Balkan Railways. Among other elements, the player opening the Orient Express (rail connection from Trieste to Istanbul) receives a bonus, as do the railroads used in the route. The terrain in the Balkans is tough, and hexes are Mountains, Hills or Clear.
 
The game is for 3-5 players, takes about an hour, with one page of expansion rules. The expansion can be used with either the Winsome original Iberian Railways game or the Rio Grande licensed Iberian Railways game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Small Railroad Empires: Freight on Board
Description:
Freight on Board is a new mini-expansion for Small Railroad Empires in which players will be able to export cargo containers via ships in port!

When a player delivers a good along their train route, if they match the good displayed on the Cargo Ship card, they will be able to place their own Cargo Container there. When the ship is full, it will sail away to export those goods, and the player that put the most containers on that ship will win the export and gain extra Prestige & Money!

Name: Motley Dice
Description:
Motley Dice is an intriguing puzzle where you roll the dice to generate a unique challenge for every game. Then you must try to place as many dice as you can into the grid, following certain placement restrictions. Challenge yourself, or try one of four different play modes to cooperate or compete with your friends.

To pack some extra punch, this mint tin comes with rules for four other dice games you can play with the 25 dice included. That's 5 games in your pocket!

—description from the designer

Name: Tapestry: Arts & Architecture
Description:
Choose from a variety of new capital city mats, a new advancement track featuring new types of cards and tiles, plus more civilizations, tapestry cards, tech cards, and landmark cards/miniatures in this second expansion for Tapestry.

—description from the publisher
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

     King Crab KGC-011
     Marauder II MAD-5A/5B/5C/6A/6C/8K/10D

Name: Blue J's Card Game
Description:
Blue J’s is a strategy game where the game grows into any shape as the cards are played out. Matching colors and/or symbols and placing them on the Start card is how the game begins. You force the other player(s) to draw cards based on how many complete squares you match. If you run out of cards you win the round or go for the quick win and match the Blue J’s. If you collect the most of nine Blue J’s Round Winner Tokens you win the game!

—description from the designer

Name: Dreams of Empire
Description:
Dreams of Empire is a competitive Deck-Building Area-Control game with Hidden Actions. Play as one of 6 Trusted Advisors to the Emperor as you try to sway the imperial council in your favor. However, the Empire is old and weak with new rumor's of revolt brought before the council each day. Without swift action the Empire will shatter. Prove to be the most Influential Advisor and the council will crown you the next Emperor! Can you make your Dreams of Empire come true?

—description from the designer

Name: Eagle Chase
Description:
In Eagle Chase, players move around the board with their die roll and with the actions on their cards visiting locations throughout the United States. Interesting geographical and historical facts are read out loud as players visit the destinations on their cards and when they catch up with the Eagle players earn a Star Token. Cards are worth one point and Star Tokens are worth two points. Be the player with the most points at the end of the game to win!

Learn interesting geographical and historical facts about some of the most well-known (and not so well-known) locations in the United States. Players travel the country, visiting as many locations as they can by playing their cards and rolling the dice, while also trying to catch up with the Eagle to earn extra points. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Euro-Game
Description:
White box with title and description "Across Europe by Game" in four languages.

The game wants to help open access to the future of Europe in a playful way. It wants to stimulate conversation and discussion, arouse curiosity, and the desire to deal more intensively with the EC member states. If the game succeeds in providing a little general education and understanding for the other EC member states and their inhabitants, then it has fulfilled its main purpose. As a supplement and to loosen up, some information about the global importance of B-Braun Melsungen AG is offered.

Contents: Game board, spinning top, dice, four game figures, 28 question cards with 254 questions and answers.

Name: Redcoats & Rebels
Description:
Redcoats and Rebels-Élan for the American War of Independence is a collaborative work based on the recently released Élan Deluxe rules for 10-25 mm miniatures by Phillip Jones with special contributions from Messrs Mark Hume (AWI specific rules and army lists), Chris Johnson (more army lists) and Greg MacPherson (campaign rules).

Presented in a style similar to Élan Deluxe, (which was recently downloaded for the 10,000th time!), Redcoats and Rebels is well indexed and written in a straightforward clause style.

At nearly 100 pages including play charts, the zipped PDF file also has internal bookmarks for ease of navigation and includes campaign and optional rules, numerous specific unit and general ratings, battle scenarios and orders of battles for several actions in the AWI.

The game is scaled for 1:25, but can be used at the 1:10 to 1:50 ratio and uses any basing system.

The rules sequence features both simultaneous and alternate actions, resulting in an intuitive and balanced game that captures the feel of the period. Individual units represented are the battalion and regiment and players can do sub-unit actions such as company and squadron actions.

The complexity of the game is moderate, and would appeal to a player who enjoys small unit tactics and a wide latitude of unit options (within historical parameters) on the table.

—description from the publisher

Name: Schichtwechsel: Sol- & Thermalbad Expansion
Description:
The mini expansion introduces a second miner and another player action card into the Game.

Sol- & Thermalbad is an 2021 exclusive expansion from the "Herner Spielerzentrum".

—description from the publisher

Name: MonsDRAWsity: Unusual Suspects
Description:
MonsDRAWsity is back with MonsDRAWsity: Unusual Suspects, a brand new, stand-alone edition to one of 2020 and 2021's best party games!

So when Deep Water Games decided to make another version, it made perfect sense to collaborate with the brilliant weirdos at Shut Up and Sit Down, a group of people known for being hilarious, energetic, wonderfully bizarre, and original. MonsDRAWsity: Unusual Suspects features over 100 new monsters conjured up by Shut Up and Sit Down and illustrated by some of your favorite (or soon to be favorite) artists.

—description from the publisher

Name: Salvar Doñana
Description:
In Salvar Doñana, several environmental problems have emerged simultaneously in the Doñana National Park. The players are expert naturalists whose mission is to discover a solution for each of the four environmental problems before they get out of hand.

On each turn, the active player can use up to four actions to travel from one point to another, mitigate environmental problems, discover a solution, or build control centers. A deck of cards will provide players with these abilities, but they will have to be careful with the catastrophe cards, which will accelerate and intensify environmental problems. A second deck of cards will control the inevitable expansion of environmental problems within the National Park.

Assuming a unique role within the team, players must plan their strategy to combine the strengths of their specialties to conquer the solution to environmental problems. But if one or more of those problems extends beyond the point of no return or if too much time passes, all players will lose. If they find a solution to the four environmental problems in time, the players will win.

—description from the designer

Name: Being Mr Bean
Description:
"Goodness me. Doesn't time fly when you're enjoying yourself?" 
- Mr Bean

Laugh out loud with this hilarious, storytelling party game where you get to get be Mr Bean!

Whether taking a leisurely stroll or making a holiday dinner, Mr Bean makes funny situations out of anything! Now it's your turn!

Lights, camera, ACTION! In Being Mr Bean, you set the scene!

Each round, one player acts as a Director and reveals a Scene card. The other players then take turns trying to explain, emote, or act out what happens next in an iconic moment from a Mr Bean comedy sketch... but watch out for the TWIST!

—description from the publisher

Name: 15 Men: Einäugiger Willie Promo Card
Description:
German card text:
"Aufdecken, um je eine Dublone aus dem Vorrat aller Spieler zu nehmen (auch von dir selbst) und zurück in die Schachtel zu legen."

Translation:
Reveal to take one doubloon from each player's supply (including your own) and put it back into the box.

Name: Liberatores: Cleopatra Promo Card
Description:
German card text:
"Immer wenn du einen Bürger zu Caesar schickst, nimmst du 1 Boten vom Vorrat und gibst ihn einem anderen Spieler."

English card text:
"Whenever you endorse a citizen to Caesar, you take a Courier from the supply and give it to another player."

Name: Gesellschafts-Kugelspiel
Description:
Each player receives a ball, which he places to his launching field. All players shoot their ball at the same time if possible. The balls roll into holes that score different points (between 5 and 50). The player who has scored the most points after 4 rounds wins the game.

—user summary

• Crucible 1/2/3

Name: トリックバイキング (Trick Viking)
Description:
In ãƒˆãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ãƒã‚¤ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚° (Trick Viking), the players want to eat a "full course", but not overeat.

The game uses a deck of 50 cards, ranked 1 to 50, but with cards of 10 different suits. The winner of a trick will "eat" each of the dishes played.  Instead of playing to a trick traditionally, a player can order more food - playing their card face down to the trick, but also adding a card from the undealt cards to their score pile.

At the end of a hand, players earn positive points if they have taken 10 or fewer cards, and 0 points if they've taken more than 10.  However, if a player has taken 10 cards and there is exactly 1 of each suit, they immediately win; otherwise, the player with the most points over the course of 4 rounds wins.

Name: Panzerkampf: Armored Clash
Description:
The Russian Front witnessed the biggest tank battles in history.  But for the crews of those vehicles, within each moment, each split second, there was only ever one target in their sights, or the one muzzle that remained unaccounted for. Commander, loader, driver…they served in a cramped world, where the events of four bloody years became nothing but an endless succession of fights for a bridge, a village, or a way out. This is Panzerkampf.

Panzerkampf pitches you into the fight via a short set of rules that have colour and detail where it matters.  Your ace crew, veterans of many such engagements, may conquer all, live to fight another day, or be killed outright by that next unseen muzzle flash. Protection, hitting power, speed, and crew experience are fundamental to the game.  But no one survives without luck, representative of which are a number of random events that can help sway the balance one way or another.  Engines stall; turrets jam; and from out of the sky come Stukas and Sturmoviks.  Their cannon are deadly, but can they always tell friend from foe?

You fight on any flat surface, manoeuvring your force of realistic miniatures and making use of the battlefield terrain supplied with the package.
To get you started, the basic set of Panzerkampf offers 3 T34/41 tank models and 3 Panzer IVf1 models, as well as a supply of scenery.

—description from the publisher

Name: Nobody's Cards
Description:
Play the game by drawing a card and improve the quality of your relationships with your family or friends. Most of our cards offer a different game for various areas of life - e.g., habits, love, exercise or comfort zone.

Minimum of two players
At the beginning of the game, each person writes down 5 bad habits of his/her opponent. Players attempt to eliminate as many of their bad habits as possible in 7 days. On the last day, they summarize their results together, discussing each bad habit in turn. The winner is the player who eliminated the most bad habits.

Name: Black Rose Wars: Promo Forgotten Evocation
Description: To celebrate the return of the (Essen) convention after last year's stop, you will find Cthuly attached to the (Ashes) magazine! This "tender" mascot of the event, vaguely inspired by ancient and forgotten myths, is a new Promo Forgotten Evocation. Comes with his Forgotten Spell and Evocation card, and a fantastic resin miniature! Of course, Cthuly can also be used in both BRW and Rebirth!

Name: Black Rose Wars: Rebirth – The Rose Duel
Description: This is a never-released version of Black Rose Wars created by Ludus Magnus Studios. It is for 2 players and follows the basic rules of the original Black Rose Wars game with minor adjustments. It is a cut-out game contained within the Fourth edition of the LMS magazine called Ashes. It contains a folded board with a smaller Lodge that has 2 mage sheets printed near the edges. It comes with 1 new school of magic 'Agony' and 3 forgotten spells.  There are no events or quest cards, instead those are printed on the game board and events are followed over the 3 turns of the game. The players control 2 new mages and can summon a new evocation called a succubus to inflict damage to others and pain upon themselves. This is a great way to introduce new players to the world of Black Rose Wars. Games are estimated at 30-60 minutes.

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Limited Edition Luke Skywalker Commander Expansion
Description:
Luke Skywalker fought on many fronts of the Galactic Civil War, battling the Empire both from the cockpit of his T-65 X-wing and on the ground with his lightsaber and trusty DL-44 blaster. Wherever the war effort took him, Skywalker was a symbol of hope to his fellow Rebels and soon Star Wars™: Legion players will get the chance to experience him like never before.

Fantasy Flight Games is happy to announce the Limited Edition Luke Skywalker Commander Expansion, available soon at your local retailer!

Ready for Action
Whether leading the fabled Rogue Squadron or a small strike team, Luke Skywalker earned his reputation as one of the Rebellion’s most enduring heroes through countless battles and this Limited Edition expansion depicts him as he appeared during one of the most iconic clashes in the Star Wars saga: the Battle of Hoth. Wearing his Rebel flight suit and perched atop the wreckage of his T-47 airspeeder, this version of Luke Skywalker is ready to continue the fight on the ground.

Not only does the miniature included here bring a totally new sculpt of Luke Skywalker to your Star Wars: Legion battles, you have the freedom to customize it to fit your personal taste. The miniature can be assembled carrying either Luke’s lightsaber or his DL-44 blaster and with or without his flight helmet. Additionally, if you decide to include the flight helmet, you can also choose whether Luke enters battle with its visor up or down.

However you decide to assemble your miniature, Luke Skywalker is as skilled as ever on the battlefield. This expansion also contains a unit card with abilities identical to the Hero of the Rebellion version of Luke Skywalker found in the Star Wars: Legion Core Set, but now featuring updated artwork matching his new appearance. Additionally, you’ll also find copies of Luke Skywalker’s command cards My Ally is the Force, Return of the Jedi, and Son of Skywalker featuring this updated artwork alongside the unit card. Finally, to ensure Luke Skywalker is fully prepared for battle, this expansion also contains reprints of four upgrade cards: Emergency Stims, Environmental Gear, Force Push, and Hope.

The Limited Edition Luke Skywalker Commander Expansion will only be available for a limited time. In the Unites States, this expansion will be available through local game stores, each of which will be eligible to receive a small amount. For those of you that live outside the United States, look for more information on distribution in your area soon!

Description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Name: ブブカ (Bubka)
Description:
In ãƒ–ãƒ–ã‚« (Bubka), seemingly named after famous Ukrainian pole vaulter, Sergey Bubka, the players are beginning pole vaulters who are bidding on a series of poles to use in their first competition.

Players will earn points for having a series of poles that are close in length at the end of the game. Each turn a pole is auctioned off, and the players have a limited set of chips to bid with, and will not receive change. Players also may not measure the pole on auction and must visually inspect it at a distance.

Name: Dragonbond: Lords of Vaala – Armies of Blood and Dreams
Description:
Increase immersion and table presence with these highly detailed miniatures (32mm scale) that replace the cardboard unit tokens from Lords of Vaala.

Cosmetic expansion of Lords of Vaala: Dragonbond  which is also a standalone game with its own cards.

Learn more about the realms and peoples of Valerna with beautiful art in the lorebook.

Name: The Acts: Heroes of the Faith
Description:
Heroes of the Faith allows you to take on the role of important figures from the book of Acts. Each hero provides you with a special ability.

Includes 8 Hero cards and rules for play.

Name: Dragonbond: Lords of Vaala – Creatures of Valerna
Description:
Hunt unique creatures from the Dragonbond universe, if you don’t become their prey first. These monsters spawn on the board and offer a new way to collect power by defeating them (Player vs Enviroment). Each one has its own unique abilities to test your strategy.

Immerse yourself in great adventures with the Creatures of Valerna, each creature have their RPG 5e Statblocks.

Name: Dragonbond: Lords of Vaala – Legends of Valerna
Description:
Bring in 4 new characters with their unique Vaala decks; 2 generals and 2 new roles featuring unique gameplay.

Haunt players with the Kadhah or play as the Fell Knight to forge temporal alliances with the highest bidder.

Extends the game to a maximum of 6 players
Duplicate player options with 4 new playable characters.

Enjoy 2 new modules: Draconic Offerings and Heroes of Valerna

In the Draconic Offerings module, the Dragons invade Valerna not only for raw power, they need to bring back offerings for their Azhurma —the Great Wyrms of Drakha.

Tokens are placed on the board during setup which the Dragons can hoard and spend to get benefits, or collect sets to claim Power tokens but Generals may attempt to find the dragons' lairs on the board to retrieve the tokens and collect Power by completing sets as well.


In Heroes of Valerna module has some Hero cards and whenever they are revealed, unique neutral champions are placed in a random uncontrolled region. These champions have a combat value of +2. Generals can attempt to defeat them and recruit them as captains for their armies. Dragons entering peacefully in regions with these heroes may become bonded, allowing them to move together, attack with +2 dice, and no longer be able to bond with Generals.

In a continent forged by war and raided by dragons, heroes can be found among the realms. There are no gods or destiny in Dragonbond. The decisions and actions of individuals is what shape this world, to start wars or to end them.

Name: Mixology
Description:
Mixology is an approachable, cocktail-themed game, featuring a Modern artistic theme and focused on hand management.

On a turn a player can do one of three actions. 1) A Player can pick up a new recipe to add to the drinks they can play. 2) They can pick up ingredients or equipment needed to make the drinks. 3) Play a drink to earn points with the opportunity to earn bonus points based on customer preferences.

First player to 21 points wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Playmat #1
Description:
Bring Car Wars Sixth Edition to life with this 36" x 36" custom playmat depicting an asphalt combat arena!

Also includes:

     Rule sheet
     30 new cards (hazard, structure, accessory, & upgrade)

Name: Periodic: A Game of the Elements – Periodic Trendsetter
Description:
A single, bonus ability card for use with the game Periodic.

During setup, place this card next to the Goal Cards. Whenever a player activates a periodic trend 3 times in the same turn, they take this card (from the Goal Area or another player) and place it in front of them. The 3 activations may be different trends of the same trend, and may occur when Spending Energy or using a Bonus Tile.

The player who currently has this card gains a bonus ability. Whenever they move their Flask, they may move up to 3 additional spaces, following the movement rules of the periodic trend they activated.

Sold as a Board Game Geek Store exclusive.

Name: Periodic: A Game of the Elements – Low-Energy Efficiency
Description:
A single, bonus ability card for use with the game Periodic.

During setup, place this card next to the Goal Cards. Whenever a player Gains Energy from a trend with 0 and 1 Energy Tokens, they take this card (from the Goal Area or from another player) and place it in front of them.

The player who currently has this card gains a bonus ability. Whenever they Spend Energy for this turn, the second periodic trend activation only costs 1 Energy Token (instead of 2). Additional activations still cost 2 Energy.

This card is sold exclusively at the Board Game Geek Store.

Name: Monopoly: Marriott International
Description:
Two of the most iconic and historic names have come together to show you why "90 never looked so good."

On this Marriott 90th Anniversary edition of MONOPOLY, you get the chance to buy, sell, and trade world-famous properties and brands like The Ritz Carlton, J.W. Marriott, St. Regis, Fairfield Inn & Suites, Aloft Hotels and many, many more while also wheeling and dealing with historic business endeavors like Hot Shoppes and In-Flite Services.

Build enough Rooms to make a Hotel on your properties, watch out for the Mini Bar Charges (and of course going to Jail) and collect as much Mr. Marriott Money as you possibly can.

Do you have what it takes to be the ultimate owner or will you check out early as your cash and construction disappear?

It’s all part of the fun as you celebrate being a part of the world’s favorite travel company!

Name: Crown Craft
Description:
Blacksmiths of Everland, rejoice! A prosperous kingdom’s royal family has announced the successor to the throne, and to celebrate, they’re offering a grand reward for the finest, most unique crown to adorn the heir. Blacksmiths from every corner of the nation are invited to compete. Gather your craftsmen, mine precious gemstones, and showcase your skills in this royal challenge. The creator of the most captivating crown will earn the admiration and praise of the royals.

Crown Craft is a competitive game for up to 4 players, each striving to design the most magnificent crown. Players visit the mines, choose their desired gems, and set them into their custom crown. Gems are mined by rolling dice, and players pair results with gem values to collect them. Each gem offers unique effects, from dice manipulation to extra income, along with valuable Victory Points.

Players can use their gems to complete their crown, sell them, or donate them to the academy, where they’ll earn magical tools to upgrade their forges. Present the most splendid crown at the game’s end and win the royal family’s favor!

—description from the designer

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Omega Red
Description:
The ultimate weapon comes to Marvel: Crisis Protocol! Once the Russian criminal Arkady Gregorivich Rossovich, Omega Red is the product of extensive and invasive experiments that transformed him into a dangerous weapon. Whether he is fighting the enemies of the Soviet Union, working for criminal masterminds, or killing to stay alive, Omega Red is a powerful and dangerous opponent. This expansion him and his carbonadium tendrils to Crisis Protocol. In additional to a beautifully detailed Omega Red miniature, this expansion also contains a stat card and three Team Tactics Cards, along with everything else players need to bring Omega Red to life on their tabletops.

~~~

Soviet-era experiments intending to create a super-soldier on par with Captain America resulted in the creation of Omega Red. Once the Russian criminal Arkady Gregorivich Rossovich, Omega Red is the product of extensive and invasive experiments that transformed him into a dangerous weapon.

The experiments implanted carbonadium tendrils into Omega Red’s body, an alloy almost as strong as adamantium, which act as his primary weapons. However, a side effect is that the radioactive carbonadium is slowly poisoning him. Omega Red must feed on the life force of others to temporarily preserve himself, which he does by wrapping his foes in his tendrils and feasting on their life force to sustain his own.

Whether he is fighting enemies, working for criminal masterminds, or killing to stay alive, Omega Red is a powerful and dangerous opponent.

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Jean Grey & Cassandra Nova
Description:
One of the first and most promising students of Xavier’s School for Gifted Youngsters, the mutant Jean Grey is gifted with the power of telepathy and telekinesis. She uses these powers as one of the founding members of the X-Men, a team of mutant heroes who protects a world that fears and hates them.

Cassandra Nova is the mummudrai of Charles Xavier, a parasitic being born to the astral plane. Her psychic entanglement with the powerful Xavier has given Nova incredible powers, including the ability to possess the bodies of others. As Charles’ dark reflection, she seeks to destroy everything he holds dear.

This pack brings both powerful characters to Marvel: Crisis Protocol with beautifully sculpted Jean Grey and Cassandra Nova miniatures. These new characters are two Team Tactic cards that unlock their full potential as well as everything else needed to include them in games of Crisis Protocol.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shekarestan: Bazaar
Description:
Based on the famous Iranian Animated TV series, Shekarestan Bazaar is a worker placement and pick up and delivery board game set in the crowded bazaar of Shekarestan Land.

Players move from one spot to another, trying to buy goods with minimum price and sell in one of the grand bazaars with the highest possible price to win the King's favor for the best merchant of the town.

Name: Tartarus: Longo Itinere
Description:
Tartarus: Longo Itinere combines a Dungeon Crawler and a Card Game with PixelArt graphic.
Dive in the Underworld, where some heroes are invited by the Devil himself to test their abilities in exchange for their most deep desire.
Fight hordes of ruthless monster, choose your path wisely and use your abilities to get to the final boss and overcome the other heroes.

In the game each player chooses a hero, each with different features and abilities. Monster's and object's cards compose the covered field in which the players will have to move choosing the direction they see fit the most.
During the game they can use abilities both defensive and offensive towards the other players, but unlike other games Tartarus features a balance between the need to weaken the opponents and keeping them alive.

Mephisto himself can come into aid during the game but be careful since the Devil can be tricky! He gives you a chance but he eventually wants your soul and you'll need to focus on finding a way to overcome his last challenge!

Name: Shekarestan: Bazazi
Description:
Based on the famous Iranian Animated TV series, Shekarestan Bazazi is a game set in a bazazi (tailoring) shop in Shekarestan Land. 
Players try to claim the customers and find a suitable fabric to gain coins and be the best tailor in town.

Name: Coup Rebellion G54: Anarchy Promos
Description: A small package containing one influence card of each new character featured in Coup Rebellion G54 - Anarchy.

Name: Race! Formula 90: Expansion #3
Description:
This is the third expansion module for Race! Formula 90 including


     two new tracks on a double-sided game board: Magny-Cours and Suzuka. Both tracks feature unique characteristics and come with 62 fully illustrated Track cards.



     the Official solo mode with increasing difficulty levels and special robot skills preserving all the thrill and extensive battling against Automa opponents.



     52 fully illustrated car tiles featuring the suites of classic formula racing


—description from the publisher

Name: Academic Society
Description:
In the 17th century, significant advancements were made in the field of science owing to the establishment of academic societies across Europe. As the leader of a faction within one such academic society, you must strive to earn prestige through your studies so that your faction can grow.
Myriad matters compete for your attention as you endeavor to maintain your influence in each of the sciences. Contributing to the kingdom’s growth by completing royal commissions, presenting your findings at conferences, and taking sabbaticals to gather knowledge in foreign lands are just a few of the tasks laid before you.
Will your quest for knowledge earn you prestige within your academic society and allow you to expand your faction?
c Society, you’ll compete to earn the most Prestige through the game’s three primary systems.

The first system involves the society board’s action spaces. Each round, you’ll place your scholars on various action spaces and perform the corresponding main actions.
Some action spaces allow you to perform a bonus action in addition to a main action; however, since there aren’t many of these special action spaces, you’ll have to anticipate what the other players will do and act accordingly.

The second system involves the management board’s influence track. At the end of the game, you’ll earn Prestige from the spaces occupied by your scholars on this track.
You can also choose to remove your scholars from the influence track and use them to perform actions starting from the next round.
Once removed, scholars cannot be returned to the influence track, forcing you to choose between earning extra Prestige at the end of the game or having more scholars on hand to perform actions with.

The third system involves the sabbatical tracks on your player board. Advancing your scholars along these tracks will earn you permanent bonuses.
However, scholars assigned to a sabbatical track stay there for the rest of the game, which means you’ll have fewer scholars available to perform actions.
Deciding if and when to assign your scholars to these tracks will require careful consideration.

As each of these systems involves your scholars, you’ll have to manage them wisely if you hope to emerge victorious.

Name: 森林守護者外傳：巡山員 (Forest Guardian Gaiden: Mountain Ranger)
Description:
Mountain Rangers is a standalone mini sequel of Forest Guardians, where players continue their mission to protect the forest and wildlife.

Throughout the game, players work on reforestation and animal rescue, while protecting mountains from wildfires and poachers. - description from game box.

Besides planting trees, players gain points when placing the wildlife in their proper habitats; also, putting out fire will produce victory points. The game ends once a player has planted all the forest meeples on their character boards.

Name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 14
Description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 14 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

• Griffin IIC/IIC 2/IIC 9
• Sentinel STN-6S
• Exterminator EXT-7X
• Ostsol OTL-5M/8E/8E3/8F/C
• Nova (Black Hawk) T/G/I/J/K/L/R
• Lightning LHN-C5
• Thug THG-13U

Name: BattleTech: Spotlight On Stone's Trackers
Description:
Backstabbers. Assassins. Cowards. Dezgra.

To the elite headhunters of Stone’s Trackers, these labels mean nothing. The only true measure of a warrior is success, and the Trackers will go to any length to ensure that Devlin Stone’s vision does not falter.

Forged in the flames of the Jihad from a secret Clan Nova Cat unit and comprised of Inner Sphere and Clan veterans alike, the Trackers take on the missions too dirty for regular commands to touch. Masters of infiltration, ambush, and marksmanship, they are the ghosts at the edge of the firelight, the wraiths that even MechWarriors have learned to fear.

From the battlefields of Operation SCOUR to glory of the Capellan Crusades, Stone’s Trackers hold to a code of honor of their own making, one that demands victory at any cost.

Spotlight On: Stone’s Trackers includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.

Name: BattleTech: Spotlight On Holt's Hilltoppers
Description:
Born in the fires of Operation: GUERRERO, Holt’s Hilltoppers took on missions from the Periphery to the Chaos March, displaying grit and tenacity to rival any famed mercenary command. Action against Periphery pirates earned the Hilltoppers a reputation as savage defenders, but disaster during the St. Ives War nearly ended the command’s existence. Steadfast courage and resilience kept them together, aided by an alliance with Periphery renegades. Glory and infamy awaited in the FedCom Civil War, along with respect and eternal enmity in equal measure. Tiring of the vagabond life, the Hilltoppers found a new home outside the boundaries of the Inner Sphere. The Fronc Reaches offer constancy, but safety is always in short supply.

Spotlight On: Holt’s Hilltoppers includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
